vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἀντιδῐκ-έω,
imperfect ἠντιδίκουν[Refs 5th c.BC+]: aorist ἠντεδίκησα[Refs]:—to be an ἀντίδικος, dispute, go to law, περί τινος[Refs 5th c.BC+]the parties to a suit, [Refs 5th c.BC+]: absolutely, of the defendant, ἀντιδικῶν[Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἀ. πρός τι or πρός τινα to urge one's suit against.., [Refs 4th c.BC+]; join issue, ἠντιδίκει ἦ μήν.., with accusative et infinitive, Lys.[same place]; oppose, rebut, διαβολαῖς[Refs 4th c.BC+]; ἀλλήλοις probably in Thugen.I[Refs 4th c.BC+]
__II passive, to be an object of dispute, Phot.p.147R.
